intro: Parnassia cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf parnassia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Parnassia cordata is often found in temperate regions and is noted for its delicate appearance and ecological significance.
